newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP's says weaker Q3 growth possible.
newsitem.headline: SAP's says weaker Q3 growth possible.

text.p: German software house SAP AG could face weaker growth in the third quarter of this year after rapid growth during the first half of 1997, chief executive Dietmar Hopp said on Thursday.
Hopp said in a text of a speech to be delivered at a news conference, "We can not rule out that the third quarter this year perhaps also brings a weakening of the growth dynamic again."
SAP executives were confident about the company's continued strong growth for the year as a whole, however.
Hopp said, "We see our chances for further growth as very positive so that we should exceed the 1997 forecast of a 25 to 30 percent increase in sales."
Management board member Henning Kagermann also said in the text of a speech that pre-tax profit in 1997 may increase somewhat faster than sales will.
"As before, we think pre-tax profit may increase somewhat faster than sales."
